page.title: 14Housing in Upper Strensham
page.content: Among the houses in Upper Strensham only one farmhouse is of any antiquity. The C18 almshouses, facing a trim village green and War Memorial, are derelect. Three old peoples bungalows are council owned, but some of the six council houses are being purchased by their occupants. Several buildings have been converted: the school is now two dwellings, the post office is now a private house and two former almshouses have been sold and made into one house. Recently four new houses have been built. Many of the 15 executive style houses change hands frequently, four are for sale now. There is no main sewer, and the only street lighting is in Court Rd. The village Hall, an 1918 army hut, has no sanitation and needs repair. The public house re-opened in Aug 85.
